title: [EPIC] üå± Green Code Sustainability Engine
body:
## Overview

Implement industry-first carbon-conscious code analysis features to help developers write energy-efficient, sustainable software.

## Business Justification

- Rising corporate ESG requirements
- EU Digital Services Act pushing for sustainable software
- Cloud cost optimization tied to energy efficiency
- No competitor offers this capability

## Scope

### Features
1. **Carbon Footprint Analyzer** - Estimate energy consumption of code patterns
2. **Green Code Suggestions** - AI-powered energy efficiency recommendations
3. **Sustainability Dashboard** - Real-time carbon impact tracking
4. **Green CI/CD Optimizer** - Schedule builds during low-carbon grid hours

### Integrations
- Cloud Carbon Footprint API
- Carbon Aware SDK
- Major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Calculate carbon footprint for any code change
- [ ] Provide 5+ green coding suggestions per analysis
- [ ] Dashboard shows historical carbon trends
- [ ] CI/CD can schedule during low-carbon periods
- [ ] Export reports for ESG compliance

## Story Points: 120
## Phase: 6
## Priority: P1 (High)

title: Carbon Footprint Analyzer - Core Engine
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want to see the estimated carbon footprint of my code changes in the PR review so that I can make environmentally conscious coding decisions.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Analyze code for energy consumption patterns
- [ ] Calculate estimated CO2 emissions per function/file
- [ ] Compare energy efficiency between before/after changes
- [ ] Display carbon metrics in PR comments
- [ ] Support JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, Java

## Technical Notes

- Integrate with energy consumption databases (e.g., Electricity Maps)
- Use algorithm complexity analysis for estimation
- Consider I/O operations, network calls, memory usage

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Green Code Sustainability Engine

title: Green Code AI Suggestions Engine
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want AI-powered suggestions for more energy-efficient code alternatives so that I can reduce the environmental impact of my software.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Identify carbon-heavy patterns (nested loops, excessive API calls)
- [ ] Suggest caching strategies to reduce data transfers
- [ ] Recommend efficient data structures and algorithms
- [ ] Suggest optimal runtime environments (serverless vs containers)
- [ ] Provide energy savings estimate for each suggestion

## Technical Notes

- Train/fine-tune model on green coding patterns
- Reference: Green Software Foundation guidelines

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Green Code Sustainability Engine

title: Sustainability Dashboard UI
body:
## User Story

As a tech lead, I want a sustainability dashboard showing our team's environmental impact so that I can track and improve our green coding practices.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Real-time carbon impact tracking per repository
- [ ] Historical trends and improvement metrics
- [ ] Team/individual sustainability scores
- [ ] Leaderboards for greenest contributors
- [ ] Export reports for ESG compliance (PDF, CSV)

## Design Requirements

- Use PrismCode design system
- Visualizations: line charts, gauges, comparisons
- Mobile-responsive

## Story Points: 13
## Parent Epic: Green Code Sustainability Engine

title: Green CI/CD Optimizer Integration
body:
## User Story

As a DevOps engineer, I want to schedule CI runs during low-carbon energy periods so that our build processes are more environmentally friendly.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Integrate with Carbon Aware SDK
- [ ] Determine optimal build times based on grid carbon intensity
- [ ] Option to delay non-urgent builds for greener windows
- [ ] Minimize test suite energy consumption
- [ ] Recommend efficient dependency trees

## Technical Notes

- Support GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins
- Use Electricity Maps API for carbon intensity data

## Story Points: 13
## Parent Epic: Green Code Sustainability Engine

title: [EPIC] ‚ôø Accessibility-First Development Agent
body:
## Overview

Make WCAG compliance automatic and developer-friendly with AI-powered auto-remediation capabilities.

## Business Justification

- Legal requirements (ADA, EAA) increasing
- 1 billion+ people globally have disabilities
- Most tools flag issues but don't fix them
- Developers lack accessibility expertise

## Scope

### Features
1. **WCAG Compliance Scanner** - Full WCAG 2.1/2.2 AA checking
2. **AI-Powered Auto-Remediation** - Auto-generate alt text, fix contrast, add ARIA
3. **Accessibility Learning Assistant** - In-context education
4. **Accessibility Score & Badges** - Track and display a11y progress

## Success Criteria

- [ ] 90%+ of WCAG 2.1 AA issues detected
- [ ] Auto-remediation available for 70%+ of issues
- [ ] Clear explanation of each fix and why it matters
- [ ] Repository accessibility badges generated

## Story Points: 100
## Phase: 6
## Priority: P1 (High)

title: WCAG Compliance Scanner Engine
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want automatic WCAG compliance checking in my PR so that I catch accessibility issues before they reach production.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Full WCAG 2.1/2.2 AA compliance checking
- [ ] Real-time scanning during development
- [ ] Map issues to specific WCAG success criteria
- [ ] Severity classification (critical, major, minor)
- [ ] Support HTML, React, Vue, Angular

## Technical Notes

- Build on top of axe-core
- Integration with Playwright for dynamic content testing

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Accessibility-First Development Agent

title: AI-Powered Accessibility Auto-Remediation
body:
## User Story

As a designer, I want AI to automatically generate alt text for UI images so that our application is accessible without manual effort.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Automatic alt text generation using vision AI
- [ ] Auto-fix color contrast issues
- [ ] Generate ARIA labels and roles automatically
- [ ] Fix heading hierarchy issues
- [ ] Provide one-click "Apply All Fixes" option

## Technical Notes

- Use multimodal AI (GPT-4V, Gemini Vision) for alt text
- Integrate with CSS for contrast calculations

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Accessibility-First Development Agent

title: Screen Reader Simulation Testing
body:
## User Story

As a QA engineer, I want to run screen reader simulations in CI/CD so that we can catch accessibility issues affecting assistive technology users.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Simulate NVDA, VoiceOver, JAWS behavior
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation flows
- [ ] Verify focus management
- [ ] Report reading order issues
- [ ] Integration with Playwright test suite

## Story Points: 13
## Parent Epic: Accessibility-First Development Agent

title: [EPIC] ü§ñ Autonomous Debugging Agent (LLM-Powered)
body:
## Overview

Move beyond static analysis to intelligent, context-aware debugging that can reason about runtime behavior and suggest fixes autonomously.

## Business Justification

- Developers spend 50%+ of time debugging
- Current tools find issues but not root causes
- LLM agents can reason about complex interactions
- No existing tool offers autonomous debugging

## Scope

### Features
1. **Intelligent Root Cause Analysis** - Analyze stack traces with full context
2. **Autonomous Fix Generation** - Generate and explain multiple fix candidates
3. **Debugging Memory System** - Remember past sessions, identify patterns
4. **Live Debug Assistant** - Real-time IDE integration

## Success Criteria

- [ ] 70% accuracy in root cause identification
- [ ] Generate working fixes for 50%+ of common bugs
- [ ] IDE integration for VS Code, Cursor, JetBrains
- [ ] Pattern database of 100+ recurring bug types

## Story Points: 150
## Phase: 6
## Priority: P0 (Critical)

title: Intelligent Root Cause Analysis Engine
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want the AI to analyze my stack trace and explain the root cause so that I can fix bugs faster.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Parse and analyze stack traces across languages
- [ ] Correlate errors across microservices
- [ ] Identify "blast radius" of bugs
- [ ] Provide root cause hypotheses with confidence scores
- [ ] Link to related code sections

## Technical Notes

- Use LLM with RAG for codebase context
- Build call graph analysis
- Support distributed tracing correlation

## Story Points: 34
## Parent Epic: Autonomous Debugging Agent

title: Autonomous Fix Generation System
body:
## User Story

As a senior developer, I want autonomous fix suggestions I can review and apply so that I can resolve bugs with minimal manual effort.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Generate multiple fix candidates for detected bugs
- [ ] Explain trade-offs of each fix
- [ ] Create accompanying unit tests for proposed fixes
- [ ] Learn from accepted/rejected fixes over time
- [ ] One-click apply with automatic PR creation

## Technical Notes

- Use reasoning models (o1, Claude 3.5)
- Implement fix validation through testing
- Build feedback loop for model improvement

## Story Points: 34
## Parent Epic: Autonomous Debugging Agent

title: Debugging Memory & Pattern Database
body:
## User Story

As a team lead, I want recurring bug patterns identified and documented so that we can prevent similar issues in the future.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Remember past debugging sessions
- [ ] Identify recurring bug patterns across projects
- [ ] Build team-specific debugging playbooks
- [ ] Cross-reference with similar issues in other projects
- [ ] Export pattern documentation

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Autonomous Debugging Agent

title: Live Debug Assistant - VS Code Extension
body:
## User Story

As a junior developer, I want an AI companion that helps me debug in real-time within my IDE so that I can learn while fixing issues.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Real-time debugging chat in VS Code/Cursor
- [ ] Suggest optimal breakpoint locations
- [ ] Explain variable states and execution flow
- [ ] Step-through guidance with AI explanations
- [ ] Integration with VS Code debugger

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Autonomous Debugging Agent

title: [EPIC] üîÆ Predictive Quality Intelligence
body:
## Overview

Predict issues before they happen using AI and historical data analysis.

## Business Justification

- Reactive analysis is the industry norm
- Predictive capabilities create competitive moat
- Historical data is currently underutilized
- Enterprise value in risk prediction

## Scope

### Features
1. **Bug Prediction Engine** - Predict which files are likely to have bugs
2. **Technical Debt Forecasting** - Project future debt growth
3. **Performance Regression Prediction** - Identify bottlenecks before deployment
4. **Security Vulnerability Forecast** - Predict dependency vulnerabilities

## Success Criteria

- [ ] 80%+ accuracy in bug-prone file prediction
- [ ] Technical debt trajectories for 6+ months
- [ ] Performance impact predictions before merge
- [ ] Proactive security alerts for risky dependencies

## Story Points: 100
## Phase: 6
## Priority: P1 (High)

title: Bug Prediction Engine
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want to know if my changes are likely to introduce bugs before I commit so that I can review high-risk areas more carefully.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Predict bug likelihood per file/function
- [ ] Risk scoring based on change patterns
- [ ] Historical pattern analysis
- [ ] Early warning for complex merges
- [ ] Visualization of prediction confidence

## Technical Notes

- Train on commit history and bug correlations
- Use code churn metrics
- Factor in complexity measures

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Predictive Quality Intelligence

title: Technical Debt Forecasting System
body:
## User Story

As a tech lead, I want to predict our technical debt trajectory so that I can plan refactoring efforts proactively.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Project future technical debt growth (3, 6, 12 months)
- [ ] Identify "debt hotspots" before they compound
- [ ] ROI calculator for refactoring efforts
- [ ] Sprint planning recommendations based on debt impact
- [ ] What-if scenario modeling

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Predictive Quality Intelligence

title: [EPIC] üîÑ Self-Healing Codebase System
body:
## Overview

Create codebases that can identify and propose fixes for their own issues autonomously, reducing maintenance burden.

## Business Justification

- "Self-healing" is a major enterprise trend
- Reduces toil and maintenance burden  
- AI can monitor and respond 24/7
- Competitive moat through automation

## Scope

### Features
1. **Autonomous Issue Detection** - Continuous quality monitoring
2. **Auto-Fix PR Generation** - Automatic PRs for detected issues
3. **Self-Healing Pipelines** - Auto-retry flaky tests, smart rollback
4. **Proactive Maintenance Scheduling** - Optimal maintenance windows

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Auto-generate PRs for 80%+ of detected security issues
- [ ] 50% reduction in flaky test failures
- [ ] Automatic dependency updates with testing
- [ ] Proactive maintenance recommendations

## Story Points: 110
## Phase: 6
## Priority: P1 (High)

title: Auto-Fix Pull Request Generator
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want automatic PRs for security vulnerability fixes so that critical issues are addressed immediately.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Generate PRs for security patches automatically
- [ ] Dependency update automation with testing
- [ ] Style and lint fix automation
- [ ] Clear PR descriptions explaining the fix
- [ ] Configurable auto-merge for low-risk fixes

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Self-Healing Codebase System

title: Self-Healing CI/CD Pipelines
body:
## User Story

As a DevOps engineer, I want self-healing pipelines that fix flaky tests automatically so that CI reliability improves without manual intervention.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Auto-retry flaky tests with smart analysis
- [ ] Automatic rollback on failed deployments
- [ ] Self-repairing CI/CD configurations
- [ ] Intelligent cache invalidation
- [ ] Flaky test quarantine and healing

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Self-Healing Codebase System

title: [EPIC] üß™ AI-Powered Test Intelligence
body:
## Overview

Make testing smarter, faster, and more comprehensive with AI-powered test generation and optimization.

## Business Justification

- Test maintenance is a major pain point
- Coverage gaps often go undetected
- Manual test creation is time-consuming
- Flaky tests waste significant developer time

## Scope

### Features
1. **Intelligent Test Generation** - Auto-generate unit and edge case tests
2. **Test Impact Analysis** - Run minimal test set for changes
3. **Flaky Test Detection & Fix** - Identify and remediate flaky tests
4. **Coverage Gap Intelligence** - Risk-based coverage recommendations

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Generate meaningful tests for 70%+ of new code
- [ ] 50%+ reduction in CI test time
- [ ] 90%+ flaky test detection accuracy
- [ ] Prioritized coverage improvement suggestions

## Story Points: 90
## Phase: 6
## Priority: P1 (High)

title: Intelligent Test Generation Engine
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want AI to generate unit tests for my new code so that I can achieve comprehensive coverage faster.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Auto-generate unit tests from code
- [ ] Generate edge case tests based on code analysis
- [ ] Create integration tests from API specs
- [ ] Property-based test generation
- [ ] Tests follow project conventions

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: AI-Powered Test Intelligence

title: Test Impact Analysis System
body:
## User Story

As a QA engineer, I want to run only the tests affected by my changes so that CI feedback is faster.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Determine minimal test set for code changes
- [ ] Skip unaffected tests intelligently
- [ ] Prioritize tests by likelihood to fail
- [ ] Reduce CI time by 50%+
- [ ] Visualization of test dependencies

## Story Points: 13
## Parent Epic: AI-Powered Test Intelligence

title: Flaky Test Detection and Remediation
body:
## User Story

As a DevOps engineer, I want automatic flaky test detection and quarantine so that unreliable tests don't block deployments.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Identify flaky tests automatically from CI history
- [ ] Root cause analysis for flakiness (timing, state, etc.)
- [ ] Suggest fixes for common flaky patterns
- [ ] Quarantine mechanism for unreliable tests
- [ ] Healing scripts for timing issues

## Story Points: 13
## Parent Epic: AI-Powered Test Intelligence

title: [EPIC] üéÆ Developer Gamification & Engagement
body:
## Overview

Make code quality improvement fun and engaging through gamification mechanics.

## Business Justification

- 73% of developers report burnout
- Gamification increases adoption by 40%+
- No code analysis tool has meaningful gamification
- Team engagement = better code quality

## Scope

### Features
1. **Achievement System** - Badges for code quality milestones
2. **Team Leaderboards & Challenges** - Weekly competitions
3. **XP & Level System** - Progression with unlockable features
4. **Code Review Rewards** - Points for helpful reviews

## Success Criteria

- [ ] 20+ unique achievements available
- [ ] Weekly team challenges running
- [ ] 30%+ increase in code review engagement
- [ ] 50% of users actively viewing their progress

## Story Points: 60
## Phase: 6
## Priority: P2 (Medium)

title: Achievement & Badge System
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want to earn badges for improving code quality so that my contributions are recognized.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] 20+ unique achievements across categories
- [ ] Rarity tiers (Common, Rare, Epic, Legendary)
- [ ] "Streak" tracking for consecutive clean builds
- [ ] Shareable achievement cards for social media
- [ ] Profile showcase of earned badges

## Story Points: 13
## Parent Epic: Developer Gamification & Engagement

title: Team Leaderboards & Weekly Challenges
body:
## User Story

As a team lead, I want to create weekly challenges to motivate the team so that code quality improvement becomes a shared goal.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Weekly code quality challenges
- [ ] Team vs. team competitions
- [ ] Individual contributor leaderboards
- [ ] Sprint-based improvement goals
- [ ] Challenge templates (Bug Squash Week, Coverage Sprint, etc.)

## Story Points: 13
## Parent Epic: Developer Gamification & Engagement

title: [EPIC] üé® Multimodal Code Understanding
body:
## Overview

Understand code through multiple modalities: text, diagrams, screenshots, and natural language for comprehensive analysis.

## Business Justification

- Current tools are text-only
- Architecture diagrams contain critical context
- Multimodal AI enables new capabilities
- Bridge gap between design and implementation

## Scope

### Features
1. **Screenshot-to-Code Analysis** - Upload UI screenshots to get code analysis
2. **Diagram-to-Architecture Mapping** - Validate code matches diagrams
3. **Documentation-Code Sync** - Detect documentation drift
4. **Voice-to-Code Commands** - Accessibility-first coding

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Parse Mermaid, Lucidchart diagrams
- [ ] Detect visual regressions from screenshots
- [ ] Auto-update docs when code changes
- [ ] Voice commands for basic operations

## Story Points: 80
## Phase: 7
## Priority: P2 (Medium)

title: Screenshot-to-Code Analysis Engine
body:
## User Story

As a frontend developer, I want to upload a Figma screenshot and get CSS suggestions so that I can match designs more accurately.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Upload UI screenshots for analysis
- [ ] Compare screenshots vs. actual implementation
- [ ] Detect visual regressions
- [ ] Suggest CSS fixes based on design screenshots
- [ ] Support PNG, JPG, Figma exports

## Technical Notes

- Use GPT-4V or Gemini Vision
- Build visual comparison algorithms

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Multimodal Code Understanding

title: Architecture Diagram Validation
body:
## User Story

As an architect, I want to validate our code matches the architecture diagram so that we maintain architectural consistency.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Parse Mermaid, PlantUML, Lucidchart diagrams
- [ ] Extract architectural components and relationships
- [ ] Compare against actual code structure
- [ ] Detect architectural drift
- [ ] Generate diagrams from existing code

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Multimodal Code Understanding

title: [EPIC] üåê Universal AI Router & Model Marketplace
body:
## Overview

Let developers choose the best AI model for each task and reduce vendor lock-in with multi-model support.

## Business Justification

- Developers want model choice flexibility
- Different models excel at different tasks
- Cost optimization across multiple providers
- Privacy-conscious local model options

## Scope

### Features
1. **Multi-Model Orchestration** - Route to optimal models
2. **Local Model Support** - Ollama, LM Studio integration
3. **Model Marketplace** - Community-contributed specialized models
4. **AI Cost Dashboard** - Track and optimize AI spending

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Support 5+ model providers
- [ ] Local model option with privacy guarantees
- [ ] 30%+ cost reduction through optimization
- [ ] Model performance benchmarks displayed

## Story Points: 70
## Phase: 7
## Priority: P2 (Medium)

title: Multi-Model Orchestration Engine
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want to choose which AI model analyzes my code so that I can optimize for accuracy, speed, or cost.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Route tasks to optimal models (GPT-4, Claude, Gemini, Llama)
- [ ] Automatic fallback on model failures
- [ ] A/B testing for model performance
- [ ] Cost-per-task optimization
- [ ] User model preferences

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Universal AI Router & Model Marketplace

title: Local Model Support (Ollama/LM Studio)
body:
## User Story

As a security-conscious enterprise, I want to use only local models so that our code never leaves our infrastructure.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Integration with Ollama
- [ ] Integration with LM Studio
- [ ] Privacy-first option for sensitive codebases
- [ ] Offline capability for air-gapped environments
- [ ] Fine-tuning support on proprietary codebases

## Story Points: 13
## Parent Epic: Universal AI Router & Model Marketplace

title: [EPIC] üåç Real-Time Global Collaboration Hub
body:
## Overview

Enable seamless collaboration for distributed teams with real-time features and knowledge management.

## Business Justification

- Remote work is the new normal
- Async tools don't capture full context
- Real-time + async collaboration needed
- Knowledge loss when team members leave

## Scope

### Features
1. **Live Code Session Sharing** - Multi-cursor collaborative editing
2. **Contextual Discussions** - Threaded discussions linked to code
3. **Knowledge Graph** - Team knowledge from code and discussions
4. **Global Team Analytics** - Collaboration pattern insights

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Real-time collaboration with <100ms latency
- [ ] AI summarization of discussions
- [ ] Searchable knowledge base from all conversations
- [ ] Team health metrics dashboard

## Story Points: 80
## Phase: 7
## Priority: P2 (Medium)

title: Live Code Session Sharing
body:
## User Story

As a developer, I want to share my coding session with a teammate for pair programming so that we can collaborate in real-time regardless of location.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Share coding sessions with team members
- [ ] Multi-cursor collaborative editing
- [ ] Integrated voice/video chat option
- [ ] Session recording and playback
- [ ] Read-only viewer mode

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Real-Time Global Collaboration Hub

title: Team Knowledge Graph
body:
## User Story

As a new team member, I want AI to help me understand team conventions and history so that I can onboard faster.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Build knowledge from code and discussions
- [ ] Search across all team conversations
- [ ] AI-powered "institutional memory"
- [ ] Onboarding automation from knowledge base
- [ ] FAQ generation from common questions

## Story Points: 21
## Parent Epic: Real-Time Global Collaboration Hub
